markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Just One More Thing](/Feats.aspx?ID=1468) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
<trait label="Investigator" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=318" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 63 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Requirements**
Your most recent action was to [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=48), [Request](/Actions.aspx?ID=51), or [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=53), and you failed but didn't critically fail.

</column>

---

After your attempt to influence someone goes poorly, you add another bit of information or ask a pointed question, possibly salvaging your previous attempt. Reroll the failed check and use the new result. If the target of the failed check is the subject of a lead you're pursuing, double your bonus from [Pursue a Lead](/Actions.aspx?ID=544) on the rerolled check. That creature is temporarily immune to Just One More Thing for 1 day.

 You can also use this action if you failed, but didn't critically fail, at a check to [Lie](/Actions.aspx?ID=47), [Gather Information](/Actions.aspx?ID=49), [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50), or [Coerce](/Actions.aspx?ID=52). In this case, rather than spending 1 action, adding Just One More Thing takes you half the amount of time you initially spent on the check, to a minimum of 1 more round.
name: Just One More Thing
requirement: Your most recent action was to  Feint ,  Request , or  Demoralize , and you failed but didn't critically fail.
requirement_markdown: Your most recent action was to [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=48), [Request](/Actions.aspx?ID=51), or [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=53), and you failed but didn't critically fail.

text: <title level="1" right="Feat 10" pfs="Standard" > Just One More Thing Single Action Source Advanced Player's Guide pg. 63 2.0 Requirements Your most recent action was to Feint, Request, or Demoralize, and you failed but didn't critically fail. --- After your attempt to influence someone goes poorly, you add another bit of information or ask a pointed question, possibly salvaging your previous attempt. Reroll the failed check and use the new result. If the target of the failed check is the subject of a lead you're pursuing, double your bonus from Pursue a Lead on the rerolled check. That creature is temporarily immune to Just One More Thing for 1 day. You can also use this action if you failed, but didn't critically fail, at a check to Lie, Gather Information, Make an Impression, or Coerce. In this case, rather than spending 1 action, adding Just One More Thing takes you half the amount of time you initially spent on the check, to a minimum of 1 more round.
